articles.title: Owners of Cuban food truck share their feelings about Hurricane Melissa

articles.title: The Politics of Hurricane Melissa
articles.author: Foreign Policy
articles.summary: The storm hit three island nations with vastly different approaches to climate adaptation, and it hit three of them with different approaches.       in particular, the island nations of Kiribati, Dominica, and the island nation of Grenada.

articles.title: Ahead of UN climate talks, Brazil says deforestation is down – DW – 10/31/2025
articles.author: Jenipher Camino Gonzalez
articles.summary: Deforestation in Brazil's portion of the Amazon rainforest has fallen for the fourth consecutive year. Deforestation is the main cause of greenhouse gas emissions. President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva has vowed to end all deforestation in the country by 2030. Since the beginning of his term in 2023, Amazon deforestation has been cut in half.

articles.title: Paint me cool: scientists reveal roof coating that can reduce surface temperatures up to 6C on hot days
articles.author: Donna Lu
articles.summary: Australian scientists have developed roof coatings that can passively cool surfaces up to 6C below ambient temperature and extract water from the atmosphere. They tested a prototype for six months on the roof of the Sydney Nanoscience Hub. It could be used in buildings in remote locations or where there is little access to groundwater.

articles.title: Capitol Notebook: Iowa AG urges federal probe into refinery exemptions under renewable fuels program
articles.author: Lee-Gazette Des Moines Bureau
articles.summary: Humans are on track to release so much greenhouse gas in the next three years that a key threshold for limiting global warming will be very hard to avoid. Iowa Attorney General Brenna Bird has asked the U.S. Department of Justice and other federal agencies to investigate whether some oil companies are improperly benefiting from exemptions under the Renewable Fuel Standard program.

articles.title: Bill Gates Dials Back Rhetoric on Climate Change, Agrees ‘Doomsday View' is ‘Wrong'
articles.author: Jobob
articles.summary: Tech founder Bill Gates has walked back his climate change alarmism. He wrote a new memo titled 'Three Tough Truths About Climate' in which he acknowledged that while climate change remains serious, it is not the world's most pressing problem. The Gates Foundation has previously spent tens of billions of dollars on initiatives focused on healthcare, education and economic development around the world.

articles.title: My lord, the flies: what's driving the sudden explosion in numbers across Sydney?
articles.author: Nick Visser
articles.summary: There are a lot of flies in Sydney. Entomologists say it's because of the warm weather. Australia has an estimated 30,000 different species of flies, many of which are pollinators for crops and native plants. articles.title: Stronger arctic cyclones speed up polar melting, impacting global weather

articles.title: Canada announces millions for Hurricane Melissa relief, plus travel advice for Jamaica, Cuba and the Caribbean

articles.title: Bill Gates has finally admitted that he was completely WRONG on ..., says Donald Trump after Microsoft founder's memo goes viral
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Bill Gates has published a memo which downplays the existential threat of climate change. US President Donald Trump took to Truth Social to claim victory over what he has long called the 'climate change hoax' and congratulated Gates for admitting he was wrong on the issue.
